inputs.note:
Patient: Afia Mensah
DOB: 09/12/1988 | MRN: MRN-0033

Subjective: 38F presents with sore throat, fever (38.8°C) x2 days. History of severe hives with Penicillin as a child.

PMH: Asthma (mild intermittent), Penicillin allergy (urticaria)
Allergies: PENICILLIN (severe hives/urticaria)

Objective:
  Vitals: BP 118/72, HR 90, Temp 38.8°C, SpO2 99%
  HEENT: Tonsillar exudates, posterior pharyngeal erythema
  Lungs: Clear bilaterally, no wheezing

Assessment: Strep Pharyngitis

Plan: Start Amoxicillin 500mg TID x 10 days. Albuterol PRN for asthma. Follow up if worsening.
inputs.meds:
Amoxicillin 500mg PO TID (NEW)
Albuterol 90mcg INH PRN
Montelukast 10mg PO Daily
inputs.labs:
Rapid Strep: POSITIVE
WBC: 12.8 K/uL (H)
CRP: 38 mg/L (H)

flags.explanation: Patient has a documented Penicillin allergy (urticaria) and is being prescribed Amoxicillin (a penicillin-class antibiotic). This presents a potential medication-allergy conflict that warrants clinical review.
